node.text: You see these fellas all the time at your local pizzeria, diced up in a risotto, or even growing on your weird, tie dye-clad neighbour's balcony. But today, we bring them to you as art. Titled Mushrooms & Friends, Phyllis Ma's (@SpecialNothing) magical series of photographs turns something quite ordinary into something spectacular. It all started when Phyllis visited a mushroom farm in Brooklyn and was instantly captivated by this jungle of weird and wonderful forms growing under blue light. Through her study, the photographer has come to understand each species' unique traits and claims that "mushrooms are a lot like people, each one has a distinct personality." #itsnicethat

On the site this week, we spoke to Studio Fisk's Bijan Berahimi for a closer look at his new publication, @JoonMagazine. In Farsi, "Joon" translates to life and is often used as a term of endearment; Bijan chose this title as a dedication to his parents and heritage. The content of Joon serves as a love letter to the city in which he lives, Portland. Beautifully-designed, the mag celebrates and exhibits bodies of work made in his city. #itsnicethat

Designer-cum illustrator @Ginko_Y has certainly had a busy year. On top of completing her master's degree at UAL, Ginko has had the chance to collaborate with some dream clients including Condé Nast and Lazy Oaf. From comics about smartphone dependence, to nostalgic 80s-inspired illustrations, Ginko always finds her own unique way to communicate the subject at hand. #itsnicethat

The work of illustrator, Wednesday Holmes (@HelloMyNameIsWednesday) provides a firm and positive message in support of those struggling with gender identity issues. Understanding the impact illustration can bring, Wednesday creates joyous works help facilitate queer liberation - their favourite projects being ones that aim to uplift their community. Their work is an absolute delight to look at and offers a sense of acceptance and hope to anyone who may gaze upon it. #itsnicethat

Weekly comic 107 by @JoaaaoSobral
∙
This week Joaõ's protagonist and his new friend from last week get all philosophical.
∙
Give it a swipe and come back next week for another! #itsnicethat #INTWeeklyComic

@Erlend.Pederk's wonderfully absurd illustrations are designed to entertain. Both silly and strange, Erlend's work open up a realm of different realities, each one a little weirder than the last. Some are based purely on visuals, with detailed scenes providing intrigue. Others are more literal, relying on comic imagery combined with text. Whilst completely bizarre, Erlend's work is somehow still very relatable - his characters' thoughts and emotions aren't often too far from our own. #itsnicethat

On the site this week, we investigate one heck of a cannabis conundrum, looking at how designers should navigate through the rapidly evolving marijuana industry.
∙
Since its increase in legalisation and de-stigmatisation, the cannabis space appears to be having a bit of an identity crisis. With a mostly irrelevant visual history, an undefinable consumer base, and strict government restrictions, building a personality for this product has become a bit of a challenge. So we spoke to the likes of @Gossamer, @Pentagram's Eddie Opara, @BlokDesign, and the woman behind the first CBD-infused tampon Valentina Milanova for a look at how designers can step up to such a high order (pun intended).
∙
For a super interesting read, hit up that link in our bio. #itsnicethat #420
∙
Illustrations by @GeniEspinosa

This month's Double Click takes a look (and a listen) at five fun-filled websites which make noise.
∙
To play a pop-up trombone, make some geometric beats, or even toy with some virtual mouth muscles, head on over to the link in our bio!
∙
Double Click is supported by @WixPlayground #itsnicethat#digitaldesign #webdesign

For January's #NicerTuesdays @_AdamaJalloh took to the stage to share a poignant body of work. Her striking, black and white photographs explore the interesting ways in which people choose to present themselves in front of her lens. From local hair salons, to young men of colour who get stopped and searched by the police, Adama opens up an honest dialogue around life in south London. You can find Adama’s full talk over in the link in our bio. #itsnicethat
∙
Event partner: @Pinterest

Avoiding the limitations of just one visual language, @JanEgbers focuses on the juxtapositions found in design and life. Whilst much of Jan's current work is image-led, a strong interest in typography presents itself in some pieces. His poster design for The Sexy Times at Sexyland combines his interesting image-making with considered typography. Inspired by George Bataille's Story of the Eye and a bizarre Youtube video of someone cracking an egg underwater, the resulting poster suits its content perfectly. #itsnicethat

Through a set of hilarious trading cards, illustrator @Mo_Winkels looks at the negative side of social media. Satrically refined and humorously composed, Moritz's zany characters exist within a series titled, #intheeyeofthebeholder!!11! - a project that encourages people to critically examine what's going on before sharing it with the internet. #itsnicethat

Good Girl Type by @MarionBisserier tackles female representation (and lack thereof) in type design. The loud-mouthed, exaggerated typeface purposefully engulfs negative space in protest of the "immaculate macho-modernist design" she felt was portrayed in western design education. Marion was also entranced by the idea of type behaving like stereotypes, and built her design to both break and connect the expectations of letterforms. #itsnicethat

Andrea Love (@AndreaAnimates) is, unbelievably, self-taught in animation. Her charming, wooly worlds show an impressive level of skill and time. She takes something familiar, something we've seen a thousand times, and presents it in unexpected ways in the form of fuzzy stop motion. We're head over heels for these joyous snippets of the everyday, and we can't wait to see what Andrea does next. #itsnicethat #stopmotion

Thaw is a new typeface by Ilya Bazhanov (@Staticolors) inspired by Russian typography from the 60s. Made to accompany his bachelor's thesis, the typeface is informed from some incredibly in-depth research into the political and cultural changes and events during the Krushchev Thaw. Like many of his other projects, this endeavour acts as a catalyst for understanding history, as well as his own narratives. #itsnicethat

On the site this week, we chat with illustrator @Saehan_Parc for an update on her joyous, egg-headed practice. A new focus of hers is trying to improve her work in an ethical manner. She's been exploring environmentally responsible processes of image production - for example, she recently made a small zine with locally-sourced paper, printed and bound in her studio. Whilst Saehan's work ethics grow and evolve each year, her style remains utterly charming and delightful to look at. #itsnicethat

Valentine's is a day of mushy romance, sickly-sweet gestures and an ungodly amount of PDA (maybe a flash of boob too). But we're not bringing you any of that shit today (apart from the boob). Instead, we're taking a look at what it's like to work with your other half and how creative couples make their love last. ⠀
∙⠀
We've spoken with real couples working in the industry together to weigh up all the pros and cons of having your partner immersed in all the same projects and ventures. @StudioNari's Caterina & Joe, @SissyScreens’ Alex and Tali, @MotherLondon's Hermeti & Ana, and @LosPereztv’s Adrian and Tania all share some of their thoughts, advice, and frustrations for such an unconventional situation. ⠀
∙⠀
Head on over to that link in our bio to read all about how they make it work. #itsnicethat⠀
∙
Boob by @MotherLondon
∙⠀
Article by @Livvy_Atkins

Baffled cats, all-seeing bums and swamp banana creatures: get ready to dive into the absurd world of illustrator @MariaJesusContreras. With a process that's unplanned and slightly chaotic, Maria manages to produce work that is consistently odd and surprising. With a vivid colour palette and reoccurring motifs, Maria's style is one that looks as if it has been plucked straight from the advertisements of a retro cartoon channel; it’s garish but ringing with charm. #itsnicethat

Weekly comic 106 by @JoaaaoSobral
∙
Scared of being alone this Valentine's day? Fear not, João's floppy protagonist shares an excellent way to make new friends.
∙
Swipe to meet the new pal, and come back next week for another! #itsnicethat #INTWeeklyComic

On the site today, we chat with Animal Press editor and graphic designer, Jinhee Han (@sujetcollectif) to talk publications, politics and colour. Having taught herself drawing and design for years, and spent time studying typography, Jeehan's outputs reflect on her multitude of skills. She designs, edits and illustrates, and does so boldly. She uses a magnificent array of colours in her work - an aesthetic choice that has always been very important to her - and each piece is just as exciting and vibrant as the last. #itsnicethat

Studio @Lob.tf, founded by long-term friends Jannis Zell and Phil Zumbruch, boasts an impressive portfolio of illustration, website design, posters and much much more. Taking inspiration from Italian furniture design, 60s typography and moving image art, the studio's versatile outputs reflect a plethora of interests. #itsnicethat

Our annual audience survey is back once more. For the 2020 questionnaire, we're asking you, our readers, to share your personal insights so we can learn and improve what we do. Not only will your feedback help the It's Nice That you know and love grow, you'll be entered into a prize draw to win some goodies. To take part, head on over to the link in our bio - it'll only take a few mins! #itsnicethat

The work of illustrator, Amy Victoria Marsh (@yayvm), is filled with humour, positivity, colour and a little bit of sass. Her portfolio of charming characters and objects can be found in both traditional illustration pieces as well as endearing ceramic creations. Whilst her mediums and technical choices differ, her unique, pink and smiley style is succinct throughout her practice. #itsnicethat

We're sure you're already familiar with the weird and wonderful work of @TheGreatSebaldo. However on the site this week, we chat with the London-based illustrator about his venture into the big bad world of animation. Our favourite oddity from this new body of work is titled Iron Man - a darkly humorous scene of a housewife ironing her husband to death. #itsnicethat

This truly joyous project by @Dag_Knudsen_Studio is just what you want to see on a Sunday. Titled, Symmetrizoo, the project highlights the satisfaction of photographic symmetry with endearing animal portraits. Even though Dag wouldn't class himself as an animal photographer, he has an uncanny ability to capture these animals in statuesque stillness. ⠀
∙⠀
“The cats can be prone to be divas but I have a good connection with them and just like human divas, they eventually give me a shot. The dogs on the other hand, are a completely different story. “The dogs pretty much shoot themselves due to their unconditional crave for either attention, or snacks. They are very corrupt. The fox was actually quite tricky. All the lizards are really quick so you have to move around and be agile. It can be a real workout.” #itsnicethat
